intro: Rhyncholacis oligandra var. tenella, commonly known as the slender-leaved rhyncholacis, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Gentianaceae and is characterized by its delicate, elongated leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its flowers are usually blue or violet in color, and they bloom during the spring and early summer. Due to habitat loss, this species is considered endangered and is of particular interest to botanists and conservationists.
